General course objectives:
General course objectives
The course gives the student in-depth knowledge and practical experience with industry leading Additive Manufacturing (AM) technologies by working on cutting-edge projects in small groups. Project work comprises all stages of a project, including planning and performing relevant laboratory investigations as well as interpretation of experimental results.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Describe various industrial AM technologies and their associated sub-systems
Evaluate the applicability of various AM technologies for production of complex geometrical components
Explain the common applications of each type of AM technology across various industries
Formulate the tasks necessary to fulfil a project focused on a specific AM technology
Perform a literature review and interpret the latest findings within state-of-the-art for a specific AM technology
Explain the process-structure-property relationships for a specific AM technology
Explain the influence of material composition and properties on the manufacturability of said material in a specific AM technology
Propose a plan to utilize a specific AM technology within a research project
Content:
The students will gain hands-on experience using one of the several possible AM technologies. The different types of AM technologies available are
1. Mask-projection vatphotopolymerization using polymers
2. Mask-projection vatphotopolymerization using slurries infused with metals and/or ceramics
3. Metal Laser Powder Bed Fusion
4. Polymer Laser Powder Bed Fusion
5. Binder Jetting using metals and ceramics
6. Extrusion-based Additive Manufacturing

The students will go through the entire manufacturing process chain including design, simulation, slicing, build preparation, AM, post-process cleaning and finishing, post-process heat and surface treatments followed by materials characterization. Each group will focus on one or several aspects of a specific AM process to perform experiment-based research to further the stated goals of the project.
